78496d8c-2a36-403f-9a54-df135a02fb5f.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed all miniprojects and a capstone project with a score of >90%. They are able to design and implement a data science project from end to end. They have gathered, cleaned, and analyzed real-world data. They have used statistical tests and machine learning algorithms to derive actionable insights from that data. They have assembled this work into a form suitable for non-experts, allowing users to solve real-world problems.
78496d8c-2a36-403f-9a54-df135a02fb5f.name: Fellowship Completion

badge_template_activities.title: The earner completed two miniprojects associated with the data wrangling module, scoring at least a 90%. They used Python libraries and SQL to gather, clean, organize, and analyze messy real-world data. They built a social graph of social connections of the population, and used that to determine influential people within the group. For the SQL miniproject, they wrote complex SQL queries to extract information from a NYC database of restaurant inspections, revealing common types of violations.

The earner completed the machine learning module and successfully completed the ml miniproject, scoring at least a 90%. They used Python and Scikit Learn to develop a machine learning model. They combine existing estimators and transformers via pipelines and feature unions, and they are able to develop custom estimators and transformers to predict venue popularity from these features. Finally, they have built an ensemble model combining several smaller models to achieve better performance.

The earner completed two miniprojects associated with the advanced machine learning module, scoring at least a 90%. They have shown the ability to use Python and Scikit Learn to develop time series machine learning models to address natural language processing and time series problems. The functioning of, and trade-offs in, more advanced models, like support vector machines, random forests, and gradient boosting trees, and had chosen, trained, and tuned their models appropriately for the domain.

The earner has completed the spark miniproject, scoring at least a 90%. They have parsed, cleaned, and processed a 10 GB set of XML files of user actions on a Q&A website. Using this behavior, they have answered questions about user behavior to predict the long-term behavior of new users. They have trained a word2vec model and a classification model on tags associated with questions. They have worked with RDDs and DataFrames, and they have implemented a machine learning pipeline using Spark ML.

The earner has completed the tensorflow miniproject, scoring at least a 90%. Their final model performs image classification with an accuracy of at least 75%. They have built and trained a series of neural networks to perform image classification, including a multi-layer perceptron, a convolutional neural network, and a network using transfer learning from a pre-trained model. They understand the many hyperparameters of a neural network and how to adjust them to avoid issues of overfitting.

The earner has completed a capstone project to the satisfaction of TDI's instructors. The capstone project requires use of real-world data to help solve a practical issue. They used modern data analysis techniques to produce a product usable by the layperson to address this issue. They have used statistical tests and machine learning algorithms to derive actionable insights from that data and assembled this work into a form suitable for non-experts, allowing users to solve real-world problems.
Earner attended courses from The Data Incubator, 21001 N Tatum Blvd Ste 1630 #642, Phoenix, AZ 85050, (480) 515-1411, thedataincubator.com, admissions@thedataincubator.com

238daba0-81d4-434b-96ca-3ba357bd2d7e.name: The Business of Data Science

The Business of Data Science

50d9c647-a1f4-4184-9fb5-855b87253ead.description: The earner of this badge has mastered the Pragmatic Data Analysis Model by completing five case studies derived from representative business problems and a unique final project implementing these skills within their own organization. They are able to define, prepare, refine, analyze and present complex data analyses for diverse business stakeholders that provide actionable insights and answer market questions with superior data analysis skills.
50d9c647-a1f4-4184-9fb5-855b87253ead.name: Business-Driven Data Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: The earner mastered the ability to ask critical questions that arrive at the crux of a business problem, disambiguate terms, and translate vague or figurative requests from multiple business stakeholders into objective, measurable goals. They can distinguish the actual problem from assumptions, misconceptions, and jargon that may be embedded into the initial request. They can articulate the desired outcomes within the business context.

The earner mastered the ability to identify potential data sources and establish timelines to collect information. They can generate consensus on thresholds, establish minimum data requirements (quality and quantity), and identify key levers while considering projected returns on investment.

The earner has completed a final project to the satisfaction of the instructor. The project requires use of real-world data to help solve a practical issue. They used data analysis techniques to produce insights and recommendations for managers, executives, and/or clients to better address the business issue for which they seek guidance.

f077d0fd-a5f5-4c13-96fa-4f4df9fd58d7.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Data Science Essentials course from The Data Incubator. They sufficiently demonstrate the ability to extract, clean and analyze data using Python; leverage Python's powerful libraries to build predictive models to make better decisions; and help their employers solve business problems using data-driven insights. They demonstrate familiarity with Object-Oriented Programming, Pandas, data visualization, NumPy, Python and more.
f077d0fd-a5f5-4c13-96fa-4f4df9fd58d7.name: Data Science Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Data Science Essentials course through The Data Incubator and successfully completed all hands-on labs and projects.
Earner attended courses from The Data Incubator, 21001 N Tatum Blvd Ste 1630 #642, Phoenix, AZ 85050, (480) 515-1411, thedataincubator.com, admissions@thedataincubator.com

80822880-cac4-403b-9618-db9c6abbb290.name: Influence Through Storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: Earner of this badge has completed the Influence Through Storytelling course through Pragmatic Institute and successfully participated in course activities, provided meaningful feedback for peers, and designed a story blueprint that met or exceeded expectations.

99ca8a06-428a-41d0-b18d-95e3c96f4b9f.description: Earner of this badge has completed the Pragmatic Institute Data Science for Business Leaders course and successfully passed the course examinations with test scores equal to or better than 70%.
99ca8a06-428a-41d0-b18d-95e3c96f4b9f.name: Data Science for Business Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Able to differentiate data roles and the skill sets and technology required for each during each phase of the Pragmatic Data Model.
Able to utilize the Pragmatic Data Model to guide business and data teams on how and when to collaborate and report on progress.
Able to articulate project requirements to the data science team
Able to identify data science constraints such as accuracy, over-fitting, computational performance and data team skill sets
Able to create a build, buy or partner plan for data projects
Able to utilize data to advocate for a specific business decision
Able to use data to align individual department goals to foster the cross- fertilization of business intelligence
Able to demonstrate how data-derived metrics enhance management’s confidence in business decisions
Able to identify the unique needs of legal and ethics regarding data science
Able to address the unique challenges within data projects when there are no clearly established solutions

9637acf9-a246-4afd-bf29-9389a65664b3.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed all miniprojects and a capstone project with a score of >90%. They are able to analyze data from a variety of sources and present it in easily understood forms. They have gathered, cleaned, and analyzed real-world data. They have retrieved and processed data from relational databases using SQL. They have created both simple and complex interactive visualizations of data. They have used machine learning tools to derive insights from that data.
9637acf9-a246-4afd-bf29-9389a65664b3.name: Data Analytics Fellowship

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed the miniproject associated with the python for data science module, scoring at least 90%. They used Python and its libraries to clean and process JSON encoded data related to social interactions. They then analyzed this data to determine how participants were connected to each other.

The earner has completed two miniprojects associated with the essential data tools module, scoring at least 90%. They use the Pandas library in Python to organize and process data from Excel, csv, and JSON files related to colleges and their communities. They have extracted insights about college prices, faculty salaries, and how colleges compare.

The earner has completed two miniprojects about SQL. They have connected to local and remote databases, retrieved data, and performed analysis on customer behavior data using SQL. They have combined data from many tables and used complex queries to extract insights about customer purchases and ad viewing.

The earner has completed two miniprojects associated with the practical machine learning module. They have used Scikit-learn to build regression models to predict housing sale prices, and classification models to predict whether cell phone customers will renew their contract. In both cases they have used feature engineering techniques and constructed pipelines to improve models performance.

The earner has completed a capstone project to the satisfaction of TDI's instructors. The capstone project requires use of real-world data to provide insight into a practical problem. They used modern data analysis techniques to prepare data that they visualized in Tableau, creating interactive dashboards. These dashboards provide their target audience with a clear view into the problem and aid them in solving it.
Earner attended courses from The Data Incubator, 21001 N Tatum Blvd Ste 1630 #642, Phoenix, AZ 85050, (480) 515-1411, thedataincubator.com, admissions@thedataincubator.com

891939c9-e81d-474f-8bb0-254a221aa674.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed mini-projects and capstone project with a score of >90%. They use machine learning tools to derive insights, develop data storage systems and create relational/non-relational data schemas with SQL and python. They curate data pipelines to transform streaming and static data, utilize AWS tools to create, transform, store and analyze data, and utilize Airflow to integrate workflow management systems.
891939c9-e81d-474f-8bb0-254a221aa674.name: Data Engineering Fellowship

badge_template_activities.title: The earner completed two mini-projects associated with the data wrangling module, scoring at least a 90%. They used Python libraries and SQL to gather, clean, organize and analyze messy real-world data. They built a social graph of social connections of the population and used that to determine influential people within the group. For the SQL mini-project, they wrote complex SQL queries to extract information from an NYC database of restaurant inspections, revealing common types of violations.

The earner completed the machine learning module and successfully completed the ML mini-project, scoring at least a 90%. They used Python and Scikit Learn to develop a machine learning model. They combine existing estimators and transformers via pipelines and feature unions, and they are able to develop custom estimators and transformers to predict venue popularity from these features. Finally, they have built an ensemble model combining several smaller models to achieve better performance.

The earner has completed the spark mini-project, scoring at least a 90%. They have parsed, cleaned, and processed a 10 GB set of XML files of user actions on a Q&A website. Using this behavior, they have answered questions about user behavior to predict the long-term behavior of new users. They have trained a word2vec model and a classification model on tags associated with questions. They have worked with RDDs and DataFrames, and they have implemented a machine learning pipeline using Spark ML.

The earner has completed two mini-projects associated with the amazon web service module. They have used AWS cloud services to build pipelines that can handle big data, and monitor these deployables through cloud tools. In both cases they have used a new Amazon Web Service tool to construct data pipelines, giving them the ability to research and implement new cloud services.

The earner has completed the Airflow mini-project. They have implemented a real-world Airflow workflow manager that handles AWS cloud services and database system tools. They have developed their own architecture to manage the movement of data within the pipeline.

The earner has completed a capstone project to the satisfaction of TDI’s instructors. The capstone project requires the use of real-world data to help solve a practical issue. They used modern data engineering techniques to produce a pipeline to address a real-world data issue. They have used modern cloud services to derive actionable insights from that data and assembled this work into a deliverable suitable for non-experts.
Earner attended courses from The Data Incubator, 21001 N Tatum Blvd Ste 1630 #642, Phoenix, AZ 85050, (480) 515-1411, thedataincubator.com, admissions@thedataincubator.com

ad393523-a1ad-4f50-a6ee-ccc0ef516dd9.description: Earner of this badge has demonstrated extensive knowledge and experience with product management and product marketing, and successful completion of instructor training.
ad393523-a1ad-4f50-a6ee-ccc0ef516dd9.name: Pragmatic Certified Product Practitioner

10+ years of executive level experience leading product teams in industry leading organizations
Successfully completed rigorous screening, training and mentorship program
Proven track record of successfully implementing the Pragmatic Framework within teams and organizations

dd07b1fc-9ad9-4357-ad3f-318e2e9f1fba.description: Earner of this badge has completed the Design course through Pragmatic Institute. The earner sufficiently demonstrates knowledge in leveraging an organization's design capabilities in product development.
dd07b1fc-9ad9-4357-ad3f-318e2e9f1fba.name: Design

badge_template_activities.title: Earner of this badge has completed the Design course through Pragmatic Institute and successfully passed the course examination with a test score equal to 70% or better.

05d922e8-cf21-48d9-9d18-e53354bd1b4a.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Essential Data Tools course. This includes understanding the fundamental data structures such as lists and dictionaries and their differences, creating for and while loops, the importance of creating and using functions, the concept of object oriented programming and creating custom classes. Further, they have demonstrated their knowledge of the NumPy and pandas Python package and why they are crucial in data science applications with Python.
05d922e8-cf21-48d9-9d18-e53354bd1b4a.name: Essential Data Tools

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge successfully passed the course multi-choice questionnaire with a test score equal to 70% or better.

The earner of this badge has successfully completed the miniproject associated with the Python module of Essential Data Tools course, scoring at least 90%. They have the ability to write working Python code involving data structures and writing regular expressions to find emails and names in a PDF.  They used regular expressions to find social securities numbers in text, built a regular expression to find in a PDF email addresses as well as names of people who belong to committee.

The earner of this badge has successfully completed the miniproject associated with the Data Analysis with pandas module of Essential Data Tools course, scoring at least 90%. They have shown the ability to use web APIs to help replace missing information in a data set. Further, they are able to load data as pandas data frames and perform necessary data analysis operations such as filtering, selecting, and merging with other data sets.

The earner of this badge has completed the Advanced Data Analysis with pandas module for Essential Data Tools through Pragmatic Institute. They have shown advanced ability with working with the pandas Python package such as grouping and applying data aggregation. Through these data aggregation, they can identify trends and obtain insight that was not apparent from the original data.

4fce9d5b-06e8-43bc-a8f8-58d94c6e80f6.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Insight course through Pragmatic Institute. The earner successfully demonstrated the ability to identify trends and solve problems with data, turn market feedback into actionable value and partner more effectively with data teams.
4fce9d5b-06e8-43bc-a8f8-58d94c6e80f6.name: Insight

badge_template_activities.title: Earner of this badge has completed the Insight course through Pragmatic Institute and successfully passed the course examination with a test score equal to or better than 70%.

62090494-b24b-41be-9793-043b1cae3295.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Practical Machine Learning course through Pragmatic Institute. They sufficiently demonstrate understanding of the goals of machine learning, the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning, the difference between regression and classification, and the Bias-Variance tradeoff in model building. They demonstrate familiarity with Python’s scikit-learn library, its transformers, predictors, pipelines and feature unions.
62090494-b24b-41be-9793-043b1cae3295.name: Practical Machine Learning

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the miniproject associated with the regression module of the Practical Machine Learning course, scoring at least 90% on each question. They utilized Python’s scikit-learn library and used its standard scaler transformer and linear regression predictor in a pipeline to build a regression model predicting home values. They improved the model by performing feature engineering while keeping the model complexity low by implementing regularization.

The earner of this badge has successfully completed the miniproject associated with the classification module of the Practical Machine Learning course, scoring at least 90% on each question. They have shown the ability to use Python’s scikit-learn library to build logistic regression models, make use of categorical features, evaluate models, tune hyperparameters, and prevent overfitting. They are able to build classification models on real-world data and draw insightful conclusions.

The earner of this badge has successfully completed the miniproject associated with the unsupervised learning module of the Practical Machine Learning course, scoring at least 90%. They worked with data describing customers of a credit card company and used unsupervised learning techniques to segment customers into clusters. They have the ability to use Python’s scikit-learn library to perform dimensionality reduction and fit a clustering model on real-world data and draw insightful conclusions.
